item.title: Boolean/Dialogue Help
item.dc:creator: @Jaxus Jaxus
item.description:
@Jaxus wrote:

[quote=“hi im bamf, post:11, topic:530764”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=649527.msg4364960#msg4364960 date=1379461334]
It means Not. Or in this case of a boolean, Not equal to…
Also, I said if you directly copied and pasted, you’d get errors…

case 18001: if(!player.PKBRID){ sendOptionDialogue(player, new int[] {18002, -1,}, "Hey, are you okay?", "I'll be going then."); }else{ player.sendMessage("You've already completed this"); } break;
[/quote]

Thank you very much for all you’ve done.
I appreciate all the help, as this has been very helpful.[/quote]
Just make sure you do not forget to use a break statement at the end of the code block for each case.

Read full topic

item.title: Boolean/Dialogue Help
item.dc:creator: @hi_im_bamf hi im bamf
item.description:
@hi_im_bamf wrote:

src\org\dementhium\content\DialogueManager.java:60: error: cannot find symbol if(!PKBRID){ ^ symbol: variable PKBRID location: class DialogueManager 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Here is my dialoguemanager:

[code] case 18001:
if(!PKBRID){
}else{

		sendOptionDialogue(player, new int[] {18002, -1,}, 
		"Hey, are you okay?", 
		"I'll be going then.");
		player.sendMessage("You've already completed this");
		}
		break;
		[/code]

Sorry if I sound silly asking as I’m still fairly new to java. What does the exclamation mark mean before the PKBRID in " if(!PKBRID){ "

Read full topic

item.title: Boolean/Dialogue Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Okay so add a quick if statement.

case YOURCASEID: if(!PKBRID){//This checks if the boolean is false, //Send your dialogues }else{ message.out("You've already completed this dialogue);//Obviously not a real statement } break;
The above is an example, it was typed up in the comment box. If you copy+paste, you’re guaranteed errors.

Read full topic

I want it to declare whether or not I’ve gone through a sequence of dialogues to determine if it should start the dialogue from the beginning or send a message saying something like “you’ve already done this” something along the lines of that.

item.title: Boolean/Dialogue Help
item.dc:creator: @hi_im_bamf hi im bamf
item.description:
@hi_im_bamf wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:2, topic:530764”]Well basically, what I would do is make it change a variable in the Player class when the dialogue is finished, and at the beginning write an: if (player.getFinishedDialogue(true)) {

Then just make it save to the player save file and boom.[/quote]

Thank you very much for that advice, I’ve tried to make it notice when the dialogue is finished but I still get errors, I’ve looked and no brackets, anything missing from what I can see. Maybe the variable is the issue?

Read full topic

item.title: Boolean/Dialogue Help
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Well basically, what I would do is make it change a variable in the Player class when the dialogue is finished, and at the beginning write an: if (player.getFinishedDialogue(true)) {

Then just make it save to the player save file and boom.

Read full topic

item.title: Boolean/Dialogue Help
item.dc:creator: @hi_im_bamf hi im bamf
item.description:
@hi_im_bamf wrote:

I’m still new into the java programming world and I’m still learning what different things mean, and I wanted to make it so that when somebody speaks to this npc and finished all the actions it recognizes that it’s been done and makes it so that you cannot repeat the process, instead it will send a message saying it was already completed. Could someone tell me if theirs something wrong with the code because I’ve tried different things and ive gotten errors in my compiler every time. (once again I’m still understanding how booleans work)

[code] case 18001:
sendOptionDialogue(player, new int[] {18002, -1,},
“Hey, are you okay?”,
“I’ll be going then.”);
if(Player.isGramps){
sendDisplayBox(player, -1, “You have already completed this task”
}else{

		}[/code]

Read full topic
